title: Racist Clan Names.
body: NGGR,NEGRO all are in-game clan names allowed by riot, can we please get someone on top of this please, it's pretty pathetic...

replies.body: If you see someone with a name or club tag like this you can report them in post-game under the "Offensive Name" category. If you can't report them in post-game for whatever reason then you can submit your report as a ticket to player support: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

They have been sending it out in recent logs, but that doesn't necessarily mean that the bot reads it, so you know, take what you think riot would do from that.

They are fairly loose. Negative Attitude basically encompasses most things that aren't explicitly listed. Basically, if a behaviour ruins the experience, particularly if it's intentional, it's reportable. 

It won't necessarily be punishable, because there are a lot of factors that go into punishments like negative/positive history, recent punishments, severity, repetition or consistency of offence etc, but all valid reports inform the system one way or another, even if they don't directly impact a punishment.

As for manual reviews (player support reports), especially when it comes to gameplay behaviours, a highlight with a match history link can make the process easier if you're willing to go that extra mile, but it's not strictly necessary, and again, see above for other factors involved.

The system (post-game reporting) can analyse 'replays' as well, though computers don't "see" the same way we do so that's a bit of an oversimplification. There's a boatload of intricate backend data that the system uses for pattern determination essentially. 

As a *general* rule gameplay behaviours can be harder and slower to analyse, simply because it's harder to determine intent. Are they playing this way because they're tilted or because they're intentionally feeding?
